Hey all, I'm new to rxjava and I'm developing a simple github client to explore rxjava features. I'm following MVP architecture. The problem I'm facing is this: I have an activity that takes username and displays user profile. To display this user profile, I have to make a network call (using Retrofit). To get the profile image, I have to make another network call. I'm also trying to set the background of this activity by getting the DarkMutedSwatch from the palette of the user image. Once I get this, I'm trying to infer if I should be using a dark theme or a light theme, so that if I have a dark background the text color must be white and if I have a light background the text color must be dark. All these are connected - to get the theme, I must know the background color. To know the background color I must have the user profile image. To get the user profile image I must have the user profile.

Initially I had separate methods that make these calls with `observeOn()` and `subscribeOn()` and all that stuff. But the problem with this is when I call the presenter to get the user profile, it spawns new threads for these calls and goes on to `setContentView()` before it has all the objects it needs to display the page. So my question is, how do I handle multiple network calls with rxjava and call the `setContentView()` _only_ after I have all the values I need.
<@U39MVHFS4|hacktheplant> has joined the channel
<@U3AFMFJH2|siery> has joined the channel
<@U3AFWUQQ4|stevepsharpe> has joined the channel
<@U08GFT5V5> what advantages does exoplayer have over using default android videoView

<@U15CXBV39> it's in the library's description:
> ExoPlayer supports features not currently supported by Android’s MediaPlayer API, including DASH and SmoothStreaming adaptive playbacks. Unlike the MediaPlayer API, ExoPlayer is easy to customize and extend, and can be updated through Play Store application updates.
<@U39P7U6EP> looking at the docs for that, and i see stuff about social media - is this what you're referring to?  For my purposes, I want to add a button like "Call via myApp". Is this possible?
